metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14952 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Double free in i18n/zonemeta.cpp in International Components for Unicode(ICU) for C/C++ through 59.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycode via a crafted string, aka a "redundant UVector entry clean up functioncall" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14952` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libicu52 - 52.1-3ubuntu0.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: icu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.1-3ubuntu0.7').
